item.title: Triple Play Helps Wireline Fight Satellite
item.description:
The market for television services is completely saturated. While getting TV used to be simple, viewers now have a wide range of options, including over-the-air, cable, satellite, telco (AT&T), and fiber optic (Verizon). The recent discontinuation of analog television transmissions was met with indifference by most, except for a small number of consumers who didn’t buy a converter or new digital TV. Now, these individuals are rushing to find converter boxes or signing up with cable or satellite providers like DirecTV or Dish Network...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/triple-play-helps-wireline-fight-satellite/
